reviews.title: A very nice mouse.
reviews.text:
I tried to use both of the most recent Apple mouse products with my Macbook Pro and never could get the hang of either one of them. I tried configuring them in the applications folder but never could get it right plus neither one of them was comfortable. One had a ball and the other newer one did not. Usually I really like apple products but not this time. I am happy to report this Logitech worked right out of the box after I plugged in the USB thingy. i didn't even have to set it up. I do like the roller ball. I think this mouse can do more than I know about, but am just happy it isn't changing the page I am on constantly. I got the one that was painted blue and green because it was about 6.00 cheaper than the solid colored ones. I like the design now that I have it. Since my laptop only has two USB plug ins, I bought the Amazon USB hub with three additional spots. Am happy with that too.
UPDATE 11-08-14
All of a sudden I am getting these messages saying the battery is critically low. To start with I was changing the batteries every time but it was happening way too fast so I bought a battery checker. Turns out my batteries are fine. Testing 100 %. the mouse continue to operate even though I continue receiving low battery warnings. Don't know how this is going to play out but it is the first sign of trouble. Now I just take battery out. Test it and when it continues to say 100 % I put it back in and the message goes away for a couple of days. Aggravating. I am amending star count down to 4 stars. Can't change stars.

reviews.title: The middle click and scroll wheel work great! Microsoft 4000 is smoother and more comfortable though.
reviews.text:
I own this mouse as well as the Microsoft Wireless Mobile Mouse 4000 now. I find them to be head to head competitors, so here's a quick comparison.

Logitech:
-Somewhat of a loud click, doesn't bother me personally, but it is obviously louder
-The harder you flick the scroll wheel the more it'll spin. There is resistance though and I feel like it's easier to use than the Microsoft mouse.
-It looks cool and functionality is fine. The middle click is easy to use and the left/right of the wheel to move back or forward in a web browser works and isn't annoyingly used by accident.

Microsoft:
-Quiet click and smoother sliding on the desk
-The wheel stops once your finger leaves it. You can't just flick and go. Scrolling seems more precise with this one, but I actually prefer the Logitech as I feel like I have more functional control with it.
-There is a side button that moves you backward in a web browser, the wheel left and right tilting doesn't seem to do anything.
-More comfortable in my hand.

Bottom line: Microsoft Wireless Mobile Mouse 4000 is smoother and more comfortable, but Logitech is more functional, especially for the middle click and scroll wheel. I was very skeptical about the benefits of this "free-wheel" but I love it now. If you're not a big scroll wheel and middle click enthusiast go with the Microsoft, otherwise the Logitech is for you.

reviews.title: Really improve the feel
reviews.text:
Before this I have never really considered changing the mouse feet. The only reason I purchased these was because I need to remove the old ones to solder in a new switch.

With the new micro switches installed. https://amzn.to/3ElgafC ( incase you are curious which ones) and the new feet this made a whole new mouse.

The feet arrived perfect no bends or wrinkles. Super easy to install. Just make sure you clean the area really good with some alcohol.

They glide so much better than stock feet. The feel is simply amazing. Now whenever I purchase a new mouse I will be upgrading the feet. If you are on the fence about it I would say go for it.

For durability I have had these on for over a month and they have no signs of wear. They still perform excellent.

Thank you for taking the time to read this and I hope that it was helpful in your purchase decision

The programmable buttons are easy to reach and press. However, if I am paying 200 for a mouse, I expected more than 3 months of use.

Edited to add:
New mouse worked almost two months before the mouse wheel stopped functioning. Went to a different brand. Cannot in good conscience recommend.

reviews.title: Mouse Hasn't Worked Properly Since Day 1, Customer Service Slow to Respond/Ineffective
reviews.text:
I bought this mouse brand new. It has NEVER worked as advertised, and Corsair's customer support team has done nothing to make it right. The mouse couldn't connect via GHz on my Macbook (despite Corsair and its reps claiming it should work on macOS. See:

https://www.amazon.com/ask/questions/Tx1JD042VHLLA6L/ref=ask_dp_dpmw_al_hza

I then tried to use a Windows laptop to connect to iCUE and program the mouse. AGAIN, nothing. They've implied that the mouse might have some compatibility issues, but that should've been addressed! They haven't even offered to refund me or replace the mouse. Stay far away from this mouse, and if you value good, responsive customer service, stay away from this company.

It looks great and feels great though and I would buy it again if it didn't cost so much money

reviews.text: Very good idea to have this jiggler built in, other similar products need to have an additional equipment, and put mouse on it for moving, not as convenient as this one. But sometimes this product is not stable, after a couple of hours working, I found the mouse stopped moving, I checked and found the battery light was off due to unknown reason, and after I reset the battery, the mouse moved again, and such kinds of issue happened several times. Therefore, I can only gave 4 stars review. But anyway I like this cute tool.

reviews.title: Keep screensavers from activating or keep from being logged off for no activity!
reviews.text:
A very handy, take it with you mouse that will keep pretty much anything from timing out due to lack of activity. When you need to step away for a few minutes and not have anything you are working on, just press the button on top to activate the jiggler and keep the mouse pointer gently moving.
I have only had this for a week or so and it has already proved it's worth. When my screen saver kicks off any process I have running slows way down. When I am rendering media this is a major pain, or I should say "used to be a major pain".
The dongle for USB connectivity stores in the mouse itself so you can carry the mouse and never have to worry about losing the dongle. It also has an on/off switch to save battery life.
A nice piece of gear, I suggest this for anyone that doesn't want to time out again.

reviews.title: Quiet and Functional
reviews.text:
I have been searching for a product like this for a long time! I work remotely most days and have to rely on connecting through a VPN connection. The connection automatically disconnects after a certain time frame, so this jiggler function is great! I can click the button to activate and leave the computer.
The setup on this mouse is so simple. I plugged in the USB and the mouse worked right away.
My favorite feature that was unexpected was how quiet the mouse is. I wasn’t use to not being able to hear a click. Such a nice product!

reviews.title: Great battery life
reviews.text: I'm still not fully decided about how I feel about this mouse. But, I can talk about what I know so far. The packaging I got the mouse and was really nice, really simple, but easy to open. The mouse was easy to set up, and the RGB looks pretty cool. There is a really cool DPI changer function that makes gaming much easier, however, I can't recommend this mouse for gaming because the ergonomics are pretty trash. I have to cramp my hand like a claw over the top of the mouse and after long periods of use it does start hurting. The surface is also pretty slippery, so I found that my hand slips on the mouse all the time. The tracking however, is great! And I would have to say that biggest plus is the battery life. I got this about 2 weeks ago, charged it once, and it is yet to die! I think the features of this mouse are great, but I would not recommend it. Purely because of the ergonomics, if you are going to use this mouse often, then you probably should go if something more ergonomic.

For the price point, this is a basic mouse.  The rotating light strip is a cool looking feature.  It is sleek in design.  It connected well with the dongle to my Surface Pro.  It glides well over a mouse pad.  It is rechargeable, which I prefer to battery operated.  The click of this mouse is quiet. The dongle slides into the bottom and of course it has already been lost.  I prefer the dongle to be stored in a closed compartment on a mouse.  It does not require recharging for several days of moderate use and seems to charge quickly.  Overall, for basic use, this mouse works well.

reviews.title: Amazing l! Always get what I order with fast shipping and selections to choose from!!
reviews.text: I’m always satisfied with anything I have ordered from Amazon and they nailed it with this order. Since I was drooping sizes I wasn’t sure!!  Super fast shipping!!! I had placed a big order, 3 days after placing order, I was opening my packages, and that’s counting the evening I placed my order!  I received  all my order at same time,I had to order several clothing items due to a major  weight loss because of illness!!!! Everything I have is too big for me now so I had nothing to wear and when I say nothing, I mean NOTHING!!! I had to order smaller sized clothes  so I’d have some clothes to wear!! I’m talking about losing 28lbs, which doctors say I’m  probably not gonna gain back, maybe  5-10lbs if I’m lucky!!!  All I been wearing is my pj’s and yes had to order some pj’s!!!!! I’m normally a small, sizes 5,6,7, weight 120-125, small frame,and am 5’3” tall. So I can’t afford to lose weight esp. 28lbs which was all lost over a 4 wk period of time, I have trouble keeping weight on me anyway!! And I can’t gorge myself with the foods that will make me gain weight cause I’m a diabetic!! So I’m in a no-win situation!!!! Thank you Amazon for giving me some cloths to wear. I ordered sizes 2-5 in slacks or jeans, small or 5-6 pj’s, small or med tops, small or 5-6 lounge clothing, so I’d say they are true to size at least for me they are. So hope that helps with ur sizing if u not sure!! Cause all the clothing was in that size range and I have 2  items that is to big out of all the clothing I ordered. Grouped all clothing in this review on size instead of  each individual piece of clothing!!! So go with ur size u are changing to and Amazon measurements to make sure and by looking at my before and after size, weight that should get u right on size u need to order.

reviews.title: I'll never go back to a flat mouse
reviews.text: I was suffering from tennis elbow for months, badly, and nothing I did was making any difference.  I have a job typing about 10 hours a day, eight days a week:/ and did some research about posture and what could cause this.  Already had an ergo keyboard, so I bought this ergo mouse.  WOW.  Unbelievable how almost immediately the tennis elbow cleared up.  This was super easy to get use to.  I have small hands, and the size is perfect.  I will never use a flat mouse again.  So very glad I stumbled upon this.  Best money I've ever spent.  Oh, and I absolutely love the fact that I do not have to replace batteries every week!

reviews.title: Well designed mouse, nothing like it
reviews.text: I love picking out a color I will enjoy looking at, other than basic black or white mice. I wanted the blue one forever, and years ago I got one in pink instead of blue per their mistake. I just kept it. I used it and yes it still works, I really wanted the blue one so I took my time to look for another one just like it and yes it is hard to find this blue color. Beautiful. The fit is very smooth and soft and perfect, they know what hands like to rest in a cupped shape and this is comfortable to work with. The glide is excellent and can be used for everyday, office, or gaming. Take a look around at other styles but you will not find one that fits like this ergonomically for the price which you cannot beat. The best part is that it is rechargeable and yes it comes with the cord and also you can use it while it is charging. Keep your wrist happy and get one.

reviews.title: Loud click, nice feel on your fingers, good for small hands
reviews.text:
Pros:
- Material on your hands feels silky. Great feel.
- Scroll wheel works nicely.
- Tracking is fine.
- Battery rather than recharge, which I like because all of the recharging ones die within a year
- On/Off switch to save your battery
- Excellent for smaller hands. I wear women's gloves size S, and this fits my hands really well.

Cons:
- The click. I have a thing with clicks. It's maddening to hear yourself click loudly all day. If the click were silent, this would be the perfect mouse. Maybe I'm a little neurotic, but it's distracting for me.

Neutral:
- The LED light near your thumb is small. I don't know why so many of mice have light strips. It seems like something else to use up the battery. I'd prefer to not have any lights, outside of what's necessary underneath for a track light. Not a big deal, and better than most.

Other:
- Made In China
- 6D Optical Mouse
- Takes 2 AAA Batteries

reviews.title: great set of premium oral care products
reviews.text: It seems like a lot of oral care companies are now going more high end, as I am starting to see toothpaste for over $10 when you can get "normal" toothpaste at the drugstore for $1-$2 (with a coupon). I was drawn to this because it is fluoride free. The toothpaste is nice and minty fresh, my mouth felt clean and fresh afterwards. I know that the brownish colored toothpaste may bother some people but I have used herbal toothpaste before so no color is "weird" or off limits for me - as long as they taste fine. There's even a few brands out there that has black colored paste! I really like the mouthwash as well and I'm surprised it is alcohol free because I feel like it does as good of a job as an alcohol one that I just recently purchased - minus the burn. My mouth just smelled and felt amazing after using both. I wasn't as fond of the dental gel as I found it useless and not something I would want to use much of. Overall this is a very nice set of oral care products and I would highly recommend the toothpaste and the mouth wash. I personally would repurchase the toothpaste and mouthwash - I hope they have a set with just those two items.

reviews.title: High quality bamboo toothbrush, worth the money!
reviews.text:
I was looking for a more sustainable toothbrush to replace the plastic ones I've been using forever. I found out about bamboo toothbrushes and I had to try them.

What I really like about these is how big the heads on them are. The wood is nice and smooth and it's easy to hold. I also prefer firm toothbrushes and picked these specifically because they were marked as "super hard" - and they really do live up to the name, because they were actually a little too hard for me. (I suspect I was brushing too hard since I'm used to different types of brushes, so it's just something I have to get used to.) I'm not knocking down the rating on that, though, because they were true to their advertising. :)

Very good brushes. I plan to buy them again.

reviews.title: A bit too soft
reviews.text:
I ordered this to replace the disposable Colgate electric toothbrush I use for travel. The Colgate does not have replaceable batteries and is a bit large for my kit, but prevents me from carrying my Sonicare. I was hopeful this would be a good replacement.

It's not quite there. The size is okay, but the bristles are very soft and the motion is very gentle. You won't hurt yourself with it, but it has nothing on the cheap Colgate or expensive Sonicare. The other problem is that the cap doesn't post onto the base. That wouldn't have been hard for them to do.

It is a gentle electric toothbrush, just too gentle for my needs.

reviews.text:
These are perfectly good replacement toothbrush heads.
They're what I would call a medium-soft bristle, which is about as soft as I like.

Minor points:
Many replacements now come with plastic hoods that snap on to protect the brush from airborne contaminates. These don't.

OEM brushes let you swap the little colored rings on the base, so you can always keep your favorite color. These don't. They have different colors, but they can't be changed.

reviews.title: Pretty good from someone that is a bit of a skeptic on the benefits of sonic toothbrushes
reviews.text:
Review for: Sparx - Electric Toothbrush, Ultrasonic Toothbrush, Cordless Toothbrush Rechargeable with Light Therapy Technology,

Having tried a couple of different sonic toothbrushes, I have not been impressed with them when compared to a true electric toothbrush. This one though, is much closer to making me a convert. It has much more vibration than others that I have tried and it does feel like it is doing more to clean my teeth. I am not sure if the blue light is really making my teeth whiter but if it is, that is a huge plus.

The brush comes with an extra head, a charger and a set of instructions.

reviews.title: Love this
reviews.text: I’ve been using this all week and really like it. I haven’t had to recharge it. It says it stays charged for 15 hours. I love the 3 different settings (clean, whiten, polish)! My teeth feel cleaner and smoother. It’s a great product!! Highly recommend!

reviews.title: my teeth feels very clean after 1 week of use
reviews.text:
[[VIDEOID:d99e4c11dd05411b9b597ceb102b22f]] Update: For some reason mine stopped turning on even after I fully charged it. However, customer service was excellent! I reached out to them on Amazon and they immediately sent me a replacement which arrived in 2 days. I am very happy with their level of customer service, in addition to this still being one of the best electronic toothbrush I've used. It really just makes my mouth feel so clean, more than the Philips one ever did. The replacement set that I received has one toothbrush head that emits blue light, and one that emits red light. In my previous set there were only blue light heads so I'm happy I finally get to try the red light. I am currently using this with a whitening gel paste from another brand and it works wonderfully. I am waiting for Sparx to come out with toothpaste (fluoride free please!) and whitening paste. Bottom line: great customer service, great product, and still highly recommend Sparx!

I really like this toothbrush and it really makes me want to brush my teeth more frequently. I have to admit I sometimes get lazy to brush my teeth but this one makes me look forward to my night time routine. I already have an electric toothbrush at home but this one caught my eye because of the LED blue light. I just had to get it because I was curious about this feature.

In terms of the brush power, I think it is great. There are different modes - clean, white, polish, and gum care. Each one vibrates in a different manner. I like that the button is big because if I want to change modes mid brush, my thumb can find it easily. I've used other electric toothbrushes where the power button is so small I couldn't really find it with my thumb. The overall design and size of the button, toothbrush head, and body is perfect, at least for me.

This does use a proprietary brush head, which currently comes in a 1 or 2 pack. It is cheaper to get the 2 pack. I am currently using the blue light version. I believe if you want the red light you'll have to purchase a different brush head. The set I got is both blue light brush heads, so there were two replaceable brush heads in the box. I believe some of their other sets comes with one blue and one red. There is a small charging stand which will need to be plugged into an outlet for the toothbrush to charge.

My only confusion with this product is how the blue light works. Will it work with my own toothpaste or does it require Sparx branded toothpaste? Does the light works to whiten teeth regardless if you use toothpaste or not? Is the LED blue light safe to use on skin? That is the only part that I needed more clarification on, and wished there was more information on this Amazon page.

Regardless of my questions, I still think this is a great electric toothbrush with a lot of potential. My teeth feels so clean after use.

reviews.title: Good Sonic Toothbrush, Confusing Instructions on Whitening
reviews.text: This is an expensive sonic toothbrush that has a blue light feature.  As a sonic toothbrush it works well but there are other options out there that are less expensive that don't require specialized replacement heads.  It is nice that this charges using an USB interface so that saves on cords when traveling.  It is generally not clear how the blue light is supposed to help.  Looking up teeth whitening technology it appears you need a special gel for the blue light to activate teeth whitening.  This is not included with the toothbrush nor discussed in the literature that I can find.  Overall, this works well as a sonic toothbrush, but you will need to purchase special teeth whitening gel to gain the benefits of the blue light as I don't really see a difference by itself.

reviews.title: Nothing fancy but does the job.
reviews.text: Toothbrushes are necessary and seem to be the one thing that I forget to purchase when I go to the store. So, ordering these Ooak toothbrushes was a no-brainer. These are not fancy. They are traditional toothbrushes that leave your teeth feeling smooth and clean (grit free). There are five rows of soft bristles…the three rows in the center are straight and the outside (colored) ones are slightly angled. The colors of the brushes are neutral, white and orange. The rubber grip handle makes it easy to grip and hold. And finally, on Amazon this two pack is under $7, which is reasonable when compared to other two packs on the market. I’d recommend these.

reviews.title: Good water flosser
reviews.text:
I got this because my last water flosser has such a tiny water reservoir I don’t bother using it. I bought this one because of the larger water reservoir.

The first time I went to use it I was ready to give it 1 star. It was terrible. No water came out and my troubleshooting efforts left me nothing but frustrated. I tossed it back in the box to try again when I was less annoyed.

Then I tried again and love it. I don’t know what worked differently, but it’s worked well since the first time. Maybe it needed to get cursed at a few times to warm up. The flosser has different settings so you can pick what’s right for you. I liked the pulse setting because it seemed to leave me with less of that annoying water flosser spray that seems inevitable no matter how careful I am.

I didn’t love the toothbrush, and the water+toothbrush setting just seemed to be a mess with no actual flossing effect. I don’t intend to use this for brushing, but it will definitely replace my old water flosser.

reviews.title: A good deal having an electric toothbrush and flosser in one!
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:5025a1cf3fd1dd9c157cb4eefde50d23]] If you can't have regular visits to the dentist, you may try this product! It is a toothbrush and flosser in one which is a good deal! It was messy on my first try as shown on the attached pic! I used the external water for the flosser and wasn't able to properly attached the flosser. I finally was able to  manage it on my subsequent attempts.  Although you can choose the different modes of output, the pressure of the water is a bit strong. I'm not sure if you can adjust the pressure. If you have sensitive gums or teeth, expect a little bleeding. Overall, this  is a great home product which I recommend!

reviews.title: WOW!
reviews.text: Nice combination. I've used the oral b, water pik and now this one. Its messy and the brush flosser isn't the hottest. By itself ok. If you disconnect the water line, plan on water everywhere. I prefer, the water pik and this brush. No fuss, no mess. Rechargeable is a plus. Looks to last a long time. Sonic vibrations are the bomb. Depending on your teeth, sonic is great. Not going back to oral b, sonic is much better. As a stand alone brush its great and worth the money for that alone.

reviews.title: Brush brush brush your teeth.
reviews.text: I've never owned a electric toothbrush so I wasn't sure what to expect. But after I received the unit I'm not sure how I survived without it. An electric toothbrush makes the tedious job of brushing your teeth a lot easier. The unit has numinous settings to (my favorite is pulse) allow you to select the best for your style of brushing. The head is relatively small so it can get all the way to your back teeth with ease. The real bonus is the water flosser feature. The first time tried it I ended up spraying the mirror and getting water everywhere since. Once i got the hang of it it felt good to use it in conjunction with he brush.  At first I couldn't figure out with the additional hose set was for. So I went back to the instructions and realized that it was for those times when I was out of my house so I could water floss.

reviews.title: Good combination but not executed well
reviews.text:
I have a sonic toothbrush that I love. I also have a water flosser that I love. I thought the idea of combining the two was genius. It made perfect sense to have a device that flushes out the spaces between your teeth while you brush. Unfortunately, while this model combines the two functions, it doesn't do either function as well as the individual devices do on their own. The vibrating toothbrush function is ok but not great. The water flosser doesn't feel like it has the same power or precision (even on the highest setting) as my stand alone water flosser. Also, the hose that connects the water flosser to the brush kinks very easily (especially if you use anything but warm water) so it's difficult to maneuver around your mouth without it stopping because the hose bent too much.
If I had never owned a vibrating toothbrush or a water flosser before I might think this was an awesome device but I was really hoping for more.

title: Oral-B 8000 Electric Toothbrush with Bluetooth Connectivity, White
description: Use the Oral-B App to seamlessly pair your Genius 8000 with a smartphone and you're on your way to brushing like your dentist recommends. The Oral-B Genius 8000 comes with Position Detection technology which uses Bluetooth technology, your smartphone, and facial recognition technology to provide you with real-time feedback about your brushing habits. The 360 Smarting with LED lights allows you to personalize your brushing experience with your choice of 12 colors. The Smarting works with the integrated timer and pressure sensor to provide you with visual feedback on brushing time and brushing pressure. Together, they help you ensure you brush for the recommended 2-minutes while making sure you brush with appropriate pressure to protect your gums from over-brushing. The premium Smart Travel Case lets you charge your brush and smartphone (via USB) at the same time while using only one wall plug. The Genius features 6 brushing modes so you can further customize your brushing experience based on your specific oral care goals. This highly advanced brush features a dentist-inspired round head that surrounds and cups each tooth with dynamic oscillating, rotating and pulsating movements to remove up to 500% more plaque than a regular manual toothbrush. Trust in the precision engineering of Braun and the dental expertise of Oral-B, the #1 brand used and recommended by dentists worldwide. 100% Satisfaction Guaranteed.

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.text:
for a top model priced as such, i was a disappointed in the feature set....no UV system to sterilize the brush head. Travel pack and main stand run on two different power systems...travel pack runs on 100-240v (universal) and main stand only runs on 110v (NA).

Does anyone know the point of the tongue mode being at the very bottom of the mode switch list? i brush my teeth and brush my tongue so the tongue mode should have been immediately after the regular brush mode

a few days use on a single charge. great build. grippy soft handle.

reviews.title: Some new features, brush works well.
reviews.text: This toothbrush is much like my old one, only this one is black. It does have a blue tooth thing that is so-so. It was a little cumbersome to get the app to work, (and had to get a new phone). The interaction between myself, the tooth brush, and the phone seems to be lacking. I envisioned real time brushing animation or something. This just times you through the selected areas. It is nice to get the bushing too hard feature well to know its there, and works. I miss the second speed my old one had this one only has one speed. I like that I can use my phone to help to remind me of my brushing responsibilities. The travel case is a nice feature as well. The design and function of this brush works well as does my old one. I was just expecting something a little more.

reviews.title: Very Good
reviews.text: Product arrived in time and exactly as presented on amazon

reviews.title: powerful toothbrush but a bit gimmicky
reviews.text:
I upgraded to this toothbrush from a vibrating-head type. The difference in cleaning-power feels dramatic. It has several different speeds for brushing teeth, gums, tongue, etc. By default, the light will blink and the toothbrush pause at certain intervals to ensure you spend enough time brushing different areas. This can be further customized with the Bluetooth unit and application. This is a neat novelty, and may be good for encouraging children to learn to brush correctly. To be honest though, when in a rush in the morning, I am not likely to take the extra step of using a phone app while brushing my teeth, and I also prefer not to take up another plug, as it’s not integrated with the charging base.

Overall I like the toothbrush a lot, but next time around, I would likely get the less expensive model without the phone accessories.

reviews.title: Great for me.
reviews.text:
These are great for me! I've gotten better over the years, but I still tend to beat up and flatten toothbrushes by brushing too hard. These might help you to be conscious of that and calm down a little bit, but if you're really bent on brushing too hard, then they'll just give you hand cramps, since now you have to push harder and at an angle. ...hopefully they'll whip you into shape.

Even if you don't have that problem, they're good solid brushes. They seem to last a while and they leave my mouth feeling clean. I like the simpler heads like this, rather than all those weird newfangled things with all the plastic in them.

reviews.title: Nice For Medium Bristles
reviews.text: I like these toothbrushes. I prefer Soft bristles, but sometimes I want a deeper cleaning so the medium bristles are good for that on occasion. The overall design is nice, and I do feel like it keeps you from brushing too hard with the way it can flex and the bristle placement—it’s enough to get your teeth clean and it’s not so harsh and abrasive compared to some other brushes. It’s still a medium brush, so if you’re sensitive, stick with soft.

Great adult sonic toothbrush for a nice value. One thing to note is this vibrates rather than spins. I am sure it helps clean better than a manual one, but I would prefer a spinning head for myself. Regardless, I enjoy using it. It comes with 6 replacement heads for a 18 month supply, which is pretty impressive. Has a 2 minute timer as well as 5 cleaning modes. 60+ day charge. Nice black color. reviews.title: Attractive yellow color!
reviews.text: First of all, I love this bright yellow colored electric toothbrush! A refreshing change from the regular black and  white sonic electric toothbrushes that are on the market right now! The bristles are ordinary but the extra brush heads make up for it. The price is just the same like the regular sonic brushes right now so it is worth a try!

reviews.title: Strong Vibration
reviews.text: Works well with strong vibration. Timer works well with 30 seconds intervals. Brushes well with soft bristles. The only thing that I personally don't like is the slippery handle. Otherwise it is a good product. Shipping was fast.

reviews.title: The Yellow is Very Cheerful
reviews.text: This is a nice electric toothbrush for the price. It has multiple settings (clean, soft, polish, massage, and white), although I tend to leave it on white most of the time. The sunny yellow color is really quite cheerful and is a bright start to the day. The bristles are softer than others I've used, which is nice for those of us who tend to brush too hard. I really like that the brush head (and even the bristles) match the body... all in the same sunny yellow. I'm also impressed that it came with so many replacement brush heads, each with their own cover. I won't need to buy replacements for a long time! I'm pretty impressed overall.

reviews.title: Indeed my gums improved after switching to this type brush head.
reviews.text:
There is a truth which dentists will tell you but is not widely discussed otherwise: Too much, too vigorous tooth brushing, and brushing with too stiff bristles will possibly damage the gums. Having said this, my dental hygienist is the one who broke the news to me that gums were starting to recede. She suggested a softer brush head for my Sonicare and to never supplement with hand brushing if the electric brush is available.

These brush heads fit the newer models of Philips Sonicare but I don't know about older models. They are listed as G2 and, compared to the more commonly found S2 brush heads, are less worrisome to use. Indeed there was significant gum healing since the checkup where the hygienist had warned me. So I'm hoping to continue to use them.

This review is unsolicited and uncompensated.

This is comparable to C3 it’s soft and gives a good clean. I can tell a difference between this and C1 or C2 but when I was using even C1 (which feels harder and I don’t like this one as much C2 is my go to) I didn’t have a cavity and my dentist said I was looking good. I do like that this head tells me when to swap out (C1 doesn’t) but $15 for a replacement is steep considering my toothbrush was $30. I will say after my second root canal I made the switch to a Phillips soniccare and since switching to sonic care from a traditional toothbrush I haven’t had any cavities. So I think using the soniccare with whatever heads you can afford is great for your dental health!

reviews.title: Pretty cool motivator for kids
reviews.text:
As the product is named, it's a manual toothbrush, so just be sure you're not expecting anything electric here. It still does involve technology as the toothbrush has a display that yields information, such as how long you've been brushing and other messages on your performance. The real feature though is that the toothbrush has a blue sensor in it which you use to connect to an app which gets information on how long you brushed, which areas, if you pressed the brush too hard on your teeth or gums, etc., and spits out a brushing report.

We thought moving to an electric toothbrush would motivate our daughter to brush more a few years ago, and it did, but the results were limited. As she's 8, and at an age where she's really becoming a bookworm, she likes reading the brushing reports and it motivates her to brush herself.

As I said the brush is manual, and obviously the bristles will wear down with time, so the head of the brush is detachable and can be replaced for $3.50 for a set of 2 (price as of January 9, 2023). Obviously, you don't want to buy a whole new brush with technology in it every time the bristles get weaker.

I'm glad this one is getting my daughter to understand to brush correctly and she wants to do it regularly to see how she's doing.

reviews.title: Cool concept to make brushing fine, interactive, and technologically appealing!

reviews.title: Amazing Price and Works Great!
reviews.text:
First off, this toothbrush is so pretty. I ordered the Green, which is really a deep turquoise with attractive, shiny gold accents. It's lightweight but feels substantial, not at all cheap. It also comes with a whopping eight (8) brush heads, which is enough for 2 years. Amazing. I also really like the brush size. Many brushes are too big for adequate brushing, but this is a really nice size. The bristles are not overly stiff, so they don't irritate my gums.

Everything with this brush is powered by a single button, pushed multiple times to change modes and held down to turn off manually. Clean mode lasts 2 minutes with a pause every 30 seconds to change quadrants before finally turning off on its own. Additional modes are Polish (I googled to discover that this helps remove stains and shine teeth post brushing), Milder (for sensitive teeth), White (whitening), and Gum Care/Massage. Obviously, the vibration makes a sound, but it's on par with the loudness of other electric toothbrushes I have used

A really nice feature is that this does not require a separate charging base. The charging cord is built right into the base (which means you cannot lose it) and accessed by twisting and removing the gold piece at the bottom, and it plugs into any USB port. When charging is complete, the USB sticks back into a slot, and the base twists back on. A full charge is expected to last 45 days, though I haven't had it long enough to know if that pans out yet!

Overall, this is a high-quality electric toothbrush that has everything you could possibly need. I'm really happy with it.

reviews.title: Vibrates vigorously
reviews.text: This toothbrush is charged by a USB cord that comes from the bottom.  Its cord is approximately 3.5 inches.  When it is charging, it blinks red and then goes to solid red when fully charged.  It comes with 8 brushes and has 5 settings. It took me a little bit to get used to because it vibrates more than any toothbrush I have ever used.  I guess that is why it is called a sonic toothbrush.  After using it several times I am now used to it, and it does do a very good job at cleaning my teeth.  I have been using it about a week and so far, I only charged it the one time.

reviews.title: Every bit as good as the ones made by Oral-B
reviews.text:
I've been using Oral-B electric toothbrushes for 15-20 years and have always purchased replacement brushes made by them. This time I decided to see if I could save some money and give these a try, and I'm very glad that I did.

The only difference I can see between the Schallcare ones and the ones sold under the Oral-B Sensitive Care label is that these fit tighter, which results in a surprisingly large reduction in the noise level, and of course they only cost 1/3 as much. I've been using one the Schallcare brushes for about 6 weeks now and it shows absolutely no wear, so I think there's a good chance they will last every bit as long as the Oral-B brand ones.

reviews.title: the Artists' (Tooth) Brush
reviews.text:
these tooth brushes are so pretty. the heads are dwarfed by the handles, but the heads are the perfect size for my mouth and the handles are the perfect size for my hands, so no complaints. been using one for the last two days, with charcoal toothpaste and tooth powder. the black bristles make it a bit harder to see when the brush is totally cleaned after brushing, but not so much that it's a problem.

the bristles are great and leave my mouth feeling squeaky clean, but I wish the heads were replaceable because the carved handles are amazing. extremely comfortable, too. I'll definitely start a collection as the bristles die, then (after sawing off the heads) sand them down and use them for something decorative. they're far too pretty to toss in the garbage.

ever since discovering bamboo fabrics a couple of years ago I've been on a bamboo kick for any and everything possible. it's long been one of my favorite plants (and the first thing I planted here at my home), and that it's sustainable/environmentally friendly has made it my go-to. hadn't even considered that there might be toothbrushes made of bamboo, but the minute I saw them I grabbed them. HIGHly recommended. bamboo is the wave of the future!

reviews.title: Nifty toothbrush, brush all the teeth at once
reviews.text:
Just add toothpaste, stick in mouth and brush side to side. Gets all the teeth clean at the same time. Very nifty. The brush head is a little flexible, so it can adjust to her jaw shape. I think the only thing that concerns me is that this is not really teaching the kid how to brush with a regular toothbrush. For now, it's really useful since she gets impatient with brushing teeth.
It came with a spare brush head which just pops on to the small metal rod. It's also very cute.

reviews.title: Simple and easy to use
reviews.text: This little toothbrush is pretty cheap in comparison to others similar to it, but it also doesn’t have any special functions. It just works as is, you put tooth paste between the bristles and then it’s used manually. No vibrations or flashing colors, but it does have a super cute design and hey at least it doesn’t need to be charged because those cords always seem to get lost too lol. Great price point for a bit more of a detailed, deep clean for kiddos’ teeth. Recommend!

reviews.title: Great for Sensitive Gums and Teeth
reviews.text:
I was told by my dentist to switch toothbrushes from manual to Oral-B electric toothbrush because it stops brushing when you brush too hard and keeps your enamel in tact, which helps relieve sensitive teeth. The dentist also recommended Oral-B because it was a good price point and has great features like a timer for 2 minutes and gets really close to the gum to get rid of icky plaque. Since I have been using Oral-B, he has noticed that I no longer have any plaque build up between cleanings and my sensitive teeth are gone. He also says my teeth look whiter and brighter. I love the toothbrush because it is light and easy to hold and get to those hard to reach places in the back of your mouth. It also leaves your teeth feeling extremely clean compared to a manual toothbrush. I can never go back to a regular toothbrush now because I tried on vacation once and felt absolutely disgusting in comparison. Oral-B is definitely the way to go for a clean mouth feel!

mouthwashes to ACT Restoring because it restores enamel that is weak and will alleviate sensitivity and use Glide Comfort Floss. Boy, was she correct. After just a few days of using the mouthwash I no longer feel that uncomfortable sensation on my teeth. I also am no longer needing prescription strength toothpaste. I now use this mouthwash twice daily and floss once a day, in combination with Sensodyne's Repair and Protect toothpaste. My gums do not bleed when I floss and I don't dread flossing. Glide floss goes easily between even the tightest teeth and has a lovely mint flavor that helps freshen breath at the same time. Changing the floss and mouthwash have made a huge improvement and now I can eat hot or cold foods without wincing in pain.

It’s one of the best toothbrushes to keep kids engaged with bright and colorful handles, as well as a twistable head that can be extended from the toothbrush handle with a twist of the bottom green knob. reviews.title: Meh its ok
reviews.text: Its just a cheap what you would get for free at the kids dentist office kind of brush. Its totally flat but thats not a huge deal for me. The brush twisting gets my kids more into brushing their teeth but when I am brushing, the brush itself doesn't lock into place as as you are going around in their mouth and moving your hand it twists and doesn't stay in place. So I am typically adjusting at least once mid brush. Usually my kiddos are good about brushing but they have their days so its those days its really an issue for me. For the price it isn't worth it for me.

Will recommend to friends and family, and buy again in the future, really great product!

reviews.title: Hate the feeling
reviews.text:
Picked this up alongside an OralB toothbrush to compare and...I don't understand why people like the Sonicare toothbrushes.

I've seen people say that you have to get used to the feeling, but it just feels awful. Not even necessarily the regular use, but if you accidentally touch the plastic to your teeth you get a horrible vibration feeling that shoots through your jaw/entire head. It also feels awful if you touch it on your lips on accident, too.

This alone made me return it in favor of the Oral B.

reviews.title: Edit: Good for my 2 year old

reviews.title: They’re ok…
reviews.text: Of the many compatible replacement heads I’ve tried, this set isn’t my favorite. It doesn’t feel as sturdy as some of the other brands I’ve tried, and rattles a bit. But it does work.

reviews.title: Make my Sonicare ineffective
reviews.text:
The toothbrush heads I received have yellow bristles in place of the advertised green. The color doesn’t matter much to me, but I’m curious if the yellow will work the way the green do and give an indication it’s time to change the brush head? Time will tell.

While I don’t mind the color, I do mind the fact that these brush heads don’t do the same sort of job brushing as do the name brand, or even other non-name brand replacements I’ve used. They fit on my Sonicare brush okay, but when I use it, it doesn’t vibrate nearly as fast or feel like it’s cleaning my teeth the way it should. While using it, I had to fight the urge to start brushing like I would with a manual toothbrush since I didn’t feel like it was doing much of anything to clean my teeth. My Sonicare seems sort of weak and ineffective with this head attached, and it’s not the Sonicare itself, because when I put the old brush head back on, it worked as expected.

reviews.title: Just as good as the name brand!
reviews.text: These replacement toothbrush heads are just as good as the Philips Sonicare ones I've bought in the past. If I closed my eyes I wouldn't know the difference. I'm definitely buying these again, plus they are close to half the price!

reviews.title: Functional And Sturdy
reviews.text: These replacement heads for Sonicare E-Series Toothbrushes arrived individually wrapped.  All of the plastic surfaces are smooth and finished.  The bristles are smooth.  They fit my Sonicare Essence perfectly, and screwed on to the handle easily.  The head of the brush is small, and fits into the back corners of my mouth easily.  They clean my teeth just as well as the name brand replacement heads, for a considerably lower price.  I would definitely recommend them.

reviews.title: Best Sonicare Replacement Heads Yet!
reviews.text: To be fair, this is the second brand I've ever tried, but still, significantly better! Reason one, these are infinitely less expensive than the Up and Up brand replacements, I bought a few years ago. I only received 3 heads for $30, compared to the 6 I received with this brand for $20. Reason two is the fit. The Up and Up brand heads weren't a perfect fit and chattered like crazy whenever I used them, which was less than ideal. These new heads are as silent as the original Sonicare head was out of the box. If you need to switch out your old worn-out head, save yourself some time and money and give these a try.

reviews.title: Surprisingly fantastic!
reviews.text:
[[VIDEOID:be0e9ab7d6ac2bbe6f1a5308058bc84a]] I have tried other electric toothbrushes but this one exceeded my expectations. My teeth felt clean and I love the built in timers. No more second guessing if you have brushed long enough with this one.

The toothbrush has a great battery life. It took several hours to fully charge but once the light indicator turned from red to green; I haven’t had to charge it again. I have brushed my teeth more than 6 times and the battery is still going strong.

Another great feature is the ability to choose cleaning speeds and (cleaning and whitening) modes with the push of a button. I really enjoyed the high frequency clean mode. When I use this toothbrush, my teeth and tongue feels amazing day and night.

And finally, I was delighted to get 5 refill brush tips. The brush tips have a small profile making it easier to brush my wisdom teeth and the bristles are gentle to my gums. This is a great toothbrush with so many features making it a good value for about $30.

reviews.title: Love this!
reviews.text:
I have no idea how they make a battery last so long! It’s a wonder for sure! I have not needed to charge this thing since I got it, and that was weeks ago.
I love all the color combos that goes with this. There’s black, pink, white… so you can actually blend it in with your bathroom decor.
I opted for the black because our new granite tops are very dark in color.
There are a bunch of attachments that I might never use, but appreciate!
And for this price?! This is an awesome price point. You can’t go wrong with this rechargeable tooth brush.

reviews.title: Adorable toothbrush and great teether as well but pricey
reviews.text:
This toothbrush/teether is BPA free and made of soft silicone. The head of the cute bear prevents the toothbrush piece from going too far into the baby's mouth but it is still long enough to act as a teether and also massage the gums. Babies usually do not start getting teeth until about 6 months so it can help the child get used to the first steps of "brushing their teeth." The current price of $12.99 ($15.99 minus $3) is a bit pricey for this.

Always supervise during use and be careful to clean this regularly. Because the brush area is grooved, it is important to give this a vigorous cleaning in that area as food, lint, etc. can get caught in that area depending on where the baby puts it.

reviews.title: Convenient, choke-proof baby toothbrush and teether
reviews.text: The whole thing is designed so that baby can't choke on it no matter which part she puts in her mouth.  The whole 'handle' is bendy silicone, which she also likes as a teether.  The wide bear head makes it easy for her to grab and hold onto it.  The brush is on all sides that you don't have to keep turning it around to get both upper and lower teeth, and still goes in enough to brush her tongue and gums.  It's all about the convenience.

reviews.title: Baby toothbrush
reviews.text: Baby now has two adorable teeth and we just started using this toothbrush before bed every night. It’s such a cute part of his bedtime routine and as he gets older he will hopefully have a great association with brushing his teeth and dental hygiene because of this

reviews.title: Great product
reviews.text:
I've been using Cybersonic for decades. My teeth don't feel clean without it.
My second handle/rechargable battery needed replacing, so I decided to try the Cybersonic 3. I was surprised how much lighter it feels. And I think the oscillation is faster, but I didn't read up on it to check. Same great result - really clean teeth. The timing indicator isn't something I wanted/needed, but doesn't bother me. I has basically ignore it. Hope this handle lasts as long as my previous ones.
I really like the charging base. I discarded the side attachments to hold extra brushes and accessories, which left me with a sleek, minimalistic charging base.
So far I'm really happy with my purchase & highly recommend this product/brand/company.

reviews.title: Huge Brush Head, Might Take Some Getting Used To.
reviews.text: I got these in the mail today and am mixed on them.  For one, I was instructed to do more brushing along the gum line for gum health, so these seem perfect.  I also really like that they are super soft bristles and are pretty gentle on that gum line, however, the brush head is huge and takes a little getting used to.  I have a big mouth and kind of wonder how this would work on a child or petit adult.  I was very happy with the brushing I got and I think I will be using these brushes exclusively in the coming months and will see how they went, once the coronavirus lockdown is over and dentists are back to work.

reviews.title: Will Take Getting Used To...
reviews.text: I was interested in trying out these toothbrushes, which I've had recommended to me by a couple of friends.  They're definitely weird in the beginning.  When you're used to a bit of coverage as you brush, having the thin strip down the middle and then on either side is a little odd.  I kept feeling like I had to rotate the brush more, which. might be a good thing?  It seems to clean as well as my normal toothbrush, but it is going to take time to be comfortable with.

Every time I purchase something online, I always check the reviews. I count on others to help me choose the best option. My reviews are always my honest opinion and I try to include photos if possible.

reviews.title: Perfect...For My Cats. :))
reviews.text: My vet advised me to brush my cats' teeth at least 3x a week. They haven't liked the typical toothbrushes used for this, so I decided to try these. They tolerate these brushes really well and even seem to enjoy the "massage" these brushes give them. I have two cats so it was great that these came in a two-pack so each gets their own toothbrush. They work well with the "cat toothpaste" I use and I haven't had any issues with the little silicone bristles coming off like the bristles on other types of toothbrushes. It slips over my finger and fits perfectly - just snug enough that I have good control, which is imperative for brushing pet teeth, and it also gives some protection in case of biting. This hasn't been an issue for me, since my cats are young and are used to having their teeth brushed at this point. The key to successful tooth brushing for cats is starting slow and being consistent. Glad to have found these, because they really do make the process a lot easier and I'm able to get the job done a lot faster and with less fuss from my fur babies. I'm also more confident that these can be kept cleaner than a typical toothbrush due to being made of silicone because the last thing you want is to spread more bacteria around! Would definitely buy these again when they wear out, but they seem durable enough that they will last for years.

reviews.title: Unable to Install Batteries, having to return item
reviews.text: I was so excited to get my new toothbrush in the mail today but have been trying for the last 30 minutes to get the thing opened so batteries can be installed & it is next to impossible. It has a “open to install” & close, I have turned it to “open to install” it will not open, have even tried to pry it open with a knife to no avail. Instruction booklet does not touch battery installation. If I could get the batteries in - I’d probably LOVE the toothbrush, as it seems to be well made & comes with a tongue scraper/brush & 2 toothbrush heads. Purchased for autistic grandson who has trouble brushing his teeth, hoping to make things easier for his little life but this mimi is getting extra frustrated with the little “no grip” cap that won’t open for battery installation. Now have to go through the dreaded process of processing a return. On a good note, if you’re purchasing it for someone who is severely disabled - you won’t have to worry about them popping the battery compartment open & choking on the batteries because it “ain’t happening” as we say in the south. ***Update to review. Customer service is awesome. Made 1 phone call & they’ve called me back twice & sending a new system with preinstalled batteries. The one I got, must’ve been a fluke. Now updated to a 5star. Very well made. Has a 2 minute timer on it that can be set for children or someone with intellectual disability so they brush teeth for right amount of time. Nice system & wonderul customer service.

★Durable brush: Thanks to DuPont bristles, our brush can be used for a long time without being easily deformed, the service life varies according to the brushing strength of each person: from 2 months for high brushing intensity to 3 months for moderate brushing intensity

★End-rounded bristles: For our brush bristles, we have adopted a variety of top-rounding techniques. The protruding bristles on the upper, middle and lower parts of the brush undergo the first rounding process; then the concave part is rounded for the second time to ensure that each bunch of bristles meet the standard. reviews.text: I'm not sure which model toothbrush I have, only that it's pretty basic and several years old, but still going strong. reviews.title: Works well for my Philips Sonicare 4100
reviews.text: This 8-pack of replacement brush heads for several Philips sonicare rechargeable toothbrush models fits my Sonicare 4100 perfectly. Popped on smoothly with no weird gaps. These are a larger size compared to the small Phillips diamond head style that I have been using and I've included a photo of a comparison showing this new replacement and the Philips sonicare branded brush side by side. I was worried they wouldn't be soft, but they are and I'm pleased with the bristles. After using for a week, I am glad I tried them and wouldn't hesitate to continue to use these and save some money.

reviews.title: Soft bristles
reviews.text:
I was running low on my Sonicare heads so I decided to give these a try, excited because they are a fraction of the cost of the name brand kind, especially for a package of 8.

They fit the handle just fine, but they aren’t chip-enabled to work with the automatic brush change reminder light on several Sonicare handles. So like regular toothbrushes you have to keep track of when you need to change it again.

I put my old ready-to-be-changed head back on immediately, as these bristles aren’t even close to “medium” hardness. They are SOFT. My old head has much stiffer-bristles than this new one, which I prefer.

I gave it a 2 rating because they do work for my Sonicare brush handle just fine, but they don’t work for me personally. If you need soft for sensitive gums, then these are for you.

You can’t go wrong with the Gum Care setting and these replacement heads if you need soft bristles. For the price, a pack of 8 is a steal!

They just aren’t for me, they are way too soft, I’m bummed.

reviews.title: tried 2 batteries for 3762 model & none charge
reviews.text:
I have 3762 model of toothbrush which is compatible based on description of product. I needed to replace the battery because original one would last for 1 week and require frequent charging..
I thought that it will be more convinient to get this battery than waiting on replacement that would be shipped from France.. However, first battery that I got was not charging at all. I soldered everything correctly, replaced original battery & was attempting to charge it for 24hrs - no luck. It wouldn't even start, the second I would press the power button it would just show red indicator right away..
And then I decided to give it another try and get replacement battery - I thought that might be I got a defective one.. I soldered 2nd battery on, and got same results.
I will be returning both while I'm waiting on JDK battery to arrive from France.
And just to mention, it seemed like pins are probably 2 times thiner than pins that original battery had. However, I didn't have any problems with them - if you're careful enough you won't break it.. but that wasn't my issue with this product.

reviews.title: Convenient
reviews.text: I was interested to try these toothbrushes because I thought they might be good for camping, travel, etc. I have used a couple of them and I will definitely use the rest, but I probably won't purchase them in the future. The design seems a bit wasteful/odd, as the handle is quite thick and sturdy but rather short. It is hard for me to keep my grip as I brush because the handle is so short, and my hands are not even that big. I feel like I don't get as good of a cleaning/scrubbing because of the short handle. I think the manufacturer could make the handle a little less thick, but longer. I think it would be more effective if that were the case. Also, the taste is pretty bland and it doesn't leave a "fresh" taste (like a fresh minty taste) in my mouth. I know my teeth are probably clean, but it just doesn't feel or taste like I'm getting as good of a cleaning as I do with my regular-sized toothbrush and minty toothpaste. For a one or two day trip, they would be fine, but for anything longer, I'd want to bring a standard toothbrush.

reviews.title: Works Great On Braces, My Kids Like Them, Brush Cover
reviews.text:
I got this Ortho Standard 33 orthodontic toothbrush almost two months ago and decided to get this value pack. My kids have trouble properly cleaning around their brackets, and since using these it’s been better. I don’t notice food stuck or buildup on their brackets.

I can’t speak from personal experience using them because I don’t have braces but my kids like them. They said that they’re soft and help to clean their teeth better with having braces. They also mentioned that it’s comfortable to hold.

I like the clear design but would prefer colored bristles or handles to easily identify household toothbrushes.

The cover for the toothbrush head is great to have!

I’d say that they work as described and worth giving a try to help brush teeth better while having braces.

reviews.title: Totally worth the price/for best results...dry your canker before applying gel
reviews.text:
I suffer from Canker sores all the time. I get them so bad, it hurts to even speak.
My sister actually turned me on to Kank-A Tooth/Mouth Pain Gel,. It really works.
Of course I had to figure out how to use it in a way that better suits me.
Best Way to use it: When you feel that canker coming on in your mouth....dry that area as much as possible. Use either a cotton ball or a tissue to dry the surface area where the sore is. The dryer the spot, the better contact you can make with the Kank-A SoftBrush Tooth/Mouth Pain Gel, Apply the gel directly to your canker sore and give it a little time to actually start drying on the sore. Sometimes you do have to sit there with your tongue out- but if you want to treat it fast and get the gel into the sore better, its worth it. Once the gel is pretty much set in, you can go back to your normal routine. You will have to reapply it a few times a day.
For the best maximum treatment and results, put it on your Canker right before going to sleep. The gel will have time to work its magic while you sleep...totally recommend using this.

reviews.title: 8 Heads more important than you might think
reviews.text:
I've been trying a bunch of similar toothbrushes lately. First off, most of the brands do not have interchangeable heads, so many of these will end up getting thrown out once the heads are used. For that reason, getting 8 heads with this is an important feature, because at least for the current price, you could hardly buy 8 disposable brushes.

One of the things I like about some others is when they have an induction charger that also acts like a little dock (of those, I prefer the ones with a USB plug rather than an AC plug). Those normally charge a premium, but this one is inexpensive, so at least they have that going for it. It's not like you have to charge it often (although definitely more than once a year), but laying a toothbrush down to plug it in is cumbersome, and it takes a while to charge.

I don't want or need the 30/120 second timers, but every single one I've ever seen (of the "sonic" type) has had that, so how can I complain? I end up brushing for 6-10 minutes most of the time.

Not a bad version of the less expensive off-brand options, but I don't think anyone can predict the future as to if and for how long replacement heads will be available.

reviews.title: I prefer the flip top ones after trying these; these sometimes fly out of my fingers
reviews.text:
There are six claw-type toothbrush holders in this package. The colors are muted but nice. However, after trying these, I prefer the flip top holders better because they are more streamlined, have an air vent for drying the brush, and are easier to operate.

These look nice on the brush but there is no air vent. The only air circulation is through the bottom hole through which the handle feeds through. Also, the act of opening the clip is cumbersome. Sometimes these almost want to fly out of my hand. In addition, they flop around on the top of the brush and take up more space. For instance, if I had a six-toothbrush holder and wanted to cover the top of every brush, I really could not do that successfully with these because they are top large and would be hitting into each other.

Nevertheless, these do what they are supposed to do except they are not my favorite.

The current price of $17.99 is an expensive $3 per holder.

reviews.title: Expensive for what they are, but handy and easy to use
reviews.text:
I've bought travel clips like these in the past that were similar to these. They're pretty much tiny enclosed hair clips that go over your toothbrush. These are more compact than others I've used so they're pretty secure on the toothbrush and don't move around in my toiletries bag. They may dent your brush's bristles of you have a larger brush.

There isn't much to these, they are sturdy and cute, but I do think they're pretty pricy for what they are. Granted, you do get 6 in the pack and would likely not have to repurchase them if you don't lose them.

reviews.title: Great toothbrush!
reviews.text: I always use the Oral B battery toothbrushes - I’m over 80, with my original teeth, and this toothbrush has kept me in good shape for years.  I like that they remind me to get a new about every three months.  The charcoal one helps to keep my teeth as white as they can be at this age - no taste involved - just mixes with your toothpaste and it does a great job.  I also find that this toothbrush brushes my gums, too, and I have not had any bleeding gums in years.  This is the only toothbrush I will buy.

reviews.title: Clean Those Teeth
reviews.text:
I love this electric tooth brush, by Oral-B as it is so different from ones I have tried before. I thought I would have to insert the battery but to my surprise it was already inserted and ready to be used. It was so easy and the button you need to push is clearly marked with a + so you push that and you are ready to add toothpaste and brush away. Just push the – sign and it stops. That was so easy and fast and you got a good brushing of your teeth. The bristles are charcoal infused bristle and this adds to completely clean your teeth and makes them feel clean.

I am wondering what one has to do if battery is used up as could not figure out where to change a battery. There was not that much explanations but I am enjoying the use of this great Oral-B for a great battery tooth brush. Great way to start the day with an Oral-B electric tooth cleaning.

title: 26.2 Marathon Girl Womens Vinyl Sticker Decal Jogging Running Shoes Run Choose Size & Color (V29) (6.25" X 3.75", Blue)
description: This vinyl decal is made of high quality indoor/outdoor rated and proven Oracal 651 vinyl!! -These are perfect for car windows, skateboards, Ipads, etc. (Practically any smooth, clean surface) -A vinyl cut sticker means that there is no background or clear backing. Only the image is the adhesive part! -These are not Cling-ons. -Please apply only to a clean, dry surface. Below are some instructions on how to apply these cool stickers: Step 1 Rub the sticker with a credit card or something with a rigid surface to be sure the transfer tape is properly adhered to the sticker. Step 2 Clean and dry the desired area. Stickers will stick best to clean smooth surfaces. Step 3 Remove the paper backing slowly making sure the sticker stays adhered to the transparent transfer tape Step 4 Carefully position the sticker to the desired area. Once the sticker sticks it will be nearly impossible to reposition without destroying the sticker. Rub the sticker from one side to the other, eliminating any air bubbles. Step 5 Use a hard edged object like a credit card to make sure the entire sticker is fully adhered to the surface. Step 6 Slowly remove the transfer tape. Making sure no part of the sticker remains on the transfer tape. Step 7 Check for air bubbles. In most cases air bubbles can be worked to the edge of the sticker, but if not, a pin hole will allow the air out and become virtually invisible, once the bubble is gone. That’s it! Your sticker is now worry free. It will last through rain, sleet, snow and gentle washing's. You can remove the sticker from glass surfaces with a razor blade or in most cases a fingernail will get the removal process started.

title: EZ-STIK 13.1 Half Marathon Decal Sticker 6" 5k 10k Running Shoes runnerA010
description: There is no background color. The surface that you apply the sticker to will become your background color. This will be a single color sticker. This is a DIE-CUT vinyl decal meaning that the background has been trimmed off. If there is a background color in the picture, it is used only as a representation. The background color will be the surface color you place the sticker on (or clear if you put it on a window). The decal will come with clear transfer tape, so you can easily apply it to anything you like (walls, windows, cars, mailbox, mirrors, laptops, etc etc etc). I use PREMIUM Oracal brand vinyl for all decals. Application is relatively easy. Your decal will come as THREE pieces - the backing paper, the sticker itself, and the clear transfer tape. Make sure you are applying to a CLEAN surface. You carefully pull the clear transfer tape up from the backing paper, making sure that it pulls the sticker up with it (if it does not, then firmly press down on it with a squee-gee or credit card or something similar until it sticks properly to the clear transfer tape). Then you apply the sticker and clear transfer tape to whatever surface you would like the decal on. You then use a squee-gee or credit card or something similar to firmly press down once again, making sure that the sticker STICKS, and then you carefully and slowly remove the clear transfer tape from the top, leaving behind only the sticker. I have found that on some surfaces (especially walls and wood surfaces), it helps to leave the clear transfer tape on for awhile to make sure everything is sticking well before removing it. I do not issue refunds or exchanges on vinyl decals. Please understand this before you bid. Some decals are more difficult to apply than others (especially the little ones!) - likewise, some surfaces are more difficult to apply decals to.

reviews.title: Work great
reviews.text: I was excited to receive these. I also have a pair that stick in the hole on the shoes. I prefer these, however, because you can adjust where the beam is directed by moving the heel strap around. I use my crocs for taking care of the chickens. So this is great for the walk to the coop every night.

reviews.title: Good quality
reviews.text: Great little product gives good light and I can pop them on my tennis shoes for camping.

reviews.title: Fun little headlights for your shoes
reviews.text: I've had these lights on my shoes full time for the last few days, and I really like them for evening walks.  They don't replace a flashlight, but they do light up a fair amount of the path that I wouldn't otherwise see with my small flashlight.  I've smacked them against car doors and chair rails a few times, and they've stayed solidly on my feet and are no worse for wear.  They are great for visibility for others too - your feet move a lot, and so do these lights.  Add flashing and you're much more visible either walking or on a bicycle.  I think they'd also be great for camping, and maybe at a dance party (flashing feet might be fun!)  My only thought is that they seem a little pricey, but they are one of the few that go on shoe laces and not just popping into holes in Crocs.  They're quite sturdy and battery life is great too.

reviews.title: Perfect for early morning/night walking
reviews.text: I bought these lights for an upcoming hike to the Grand Canyon in October. We need to start our hike before sunrise and thought these would be the perfect accessory to stop us from tripping in the dark. What I like - they are small and lightweight, with a secure clip for my shoes. The battery is a standard size. They are easy to turn off and on. I'm undecided on if these are really bright enough to be practical... is there a light - yes. Is it going to replace a flashlight - absolutely not. I don't know if I'd buy these again for the purpose of a hike, but they would be good if you are an early morning/late evening walker and runner and want additional lights for safety so cars, etc, can see you.

He chose the name ASICS for his company in 1977, based on a famous Latin phrase "Anima Sana In Corpore Sano," which, when translated, expresses the ancient ideal of "A Sound Mind in a Sound Body." Taking the acronym of this phrase, ASICS was founded on the belief that the best way to create a healthy and happy lifestyle is to promote total health and fitness. Today, ASICS offers a full line of performance-driven athletic shoes and technical active sports apparel and accessories dedicated to bringing harmony to the body and soul.

reviews.title: Light, neutral shoe
reviews.text: Saucony neutral running shoes are the only kind of running shoes that I have ever purchased. reviews.title: Lightweight and breathable
reviews.text:
Pros:
-Overall these shoes are pretty lightweight and breathable. Good amount of air flow with the mesh siding, however you need to take good care of these as the mesh can rip easier when you catch your foot on a step.
-I am a huge fan of saucony and have never had bad results with any of their shoes over the past 20 years. These shoes appear to be more of a basic model that I would expect to last about a year or 1 marathon season.
-No issues with blisters or rubbing.

Cons:
-There isn’t much grip/tread on the bottom of these shoes. For this reason, I don’t expect these to hold up as well as some of the other models of Saucony shoes I’ve had in the past.

reviews.title: True Fit
reviews.text: I have been wearing Saucony shoes for a few years now. They're one of the few shoe brands that I can order without trying on first. I can count on their shoes being true fit. I do find them to be less cushiony than I am used to. Maybe it's because they are running shoes. They are still comfortable to wear. I like the black and silver colors.

title: ASICS Men's Gel-Kayano 26 Running Shoes
description: Celebrate the retro style of the historic Japanese capital in this special edition GEL-KAYANO 26 Retro Tokyo running shoe from ASICS. This updated version combines advanced components with a striking new design that honors Tokyo's heritage. The GEL-KAYANO 26 shoe allows you to tackle long distances in comfort, thanks to the rearfoot GEL technology that's been redesigned for improved shock absorption upon impact. You'll also benefit from a bouncy feel that stems from the FLYTEFOAM Propel midsole technology. The DUOMAX technology in the midsole offers better support and helps resist excessive overpronation while I.G.S. technology promotes smoother propulsion. Additionally, this style is accented with reflective detailing to improve your visibility when running in low light settings. Get the inspiration and support you need to smash your training goals in the special edition GEL-KAYANO 26 Retro Tokyo performance running shoe from ASICS.

reviews.title: ASICS Men's Gel-Kayano 26 doesn't work for me
reviews.text:
I really wanted to love these shoes. I bought the Black ones and they looked great. But trying them on was another thing. Under where my toes connect to my feet there is a ridge or slight raised part that I could really feel. From the ridge to the toe of the shoe my toes seemed to slightly drop making the shoe very uncomfortable for me.
I am really glad that I purchased them through Amazon the free return policy worked for me. I sent the shoes back the next morning. The credit showed up the next morning.

reviews.title: Update:Tread showing considerable wear after 70 miles
reviews.text:
Two star: Upper is holding up nicely. Tread is already worn out after only 70 miles. I tried ASICS because reviews talk of superior durability. So far for me upper is good, sole is not.

Update: I reached out to ASICS about the tread life. After sending pictures of tread wear after 70 miles they sent code for replacement shoe from ASICS.com.
That’s pretty awesome customer service in my book.

So far 20 miles on new Kayano fit and finish is great.

Comfort on gel-Kayano 28 is far superior to previous models.

Extra wide is a touch narrow but all in all the first 20 miles is running great.

title: ASICS Men's Gel-Venture 7 Running Shoes
description: Take on the toughest terrain in confidence with the men's GEL-VENTURE 7 performance trail running shoe by ASICS. Featuring GEL technology and an EVA midsole, this shoe is made for athletes who love to run in the great outdoors. GEL technology in the rearfoot area of the shoe provides shock absorption where you need it most, while the ORTHOLITE sockliner provides an additional layer of cushioning underfoot. It even molds to the shape of your feet, making each run even more comfortable than the last. Extra support comes from the sturdy upper crafted from synthetic leather, while the internal heel counter gently helps your foot remain in its natural line of motion, making for a more efficient stride. Meanwhile the EVA midsole protects your feet against impact and increases rebound, giving you an energetic feeling as you clock up the miles. Durable and practical, the GEL-VENTURE 7 shoe makes an excellent training partner whether you're new to trail running or a seasoned pro.

reviews.title: It's okay!
reviews.text:
These are based off the famous shoe from the other brand , it rhymes with Beezy450, which costs $100s of dollars! They are just a sock mesh put into a mold, where hot rubber is poured into the bottom which makes the sole. Put in a soft insole and boom, you got a foam runner shoe. Well these shoes are the same thing as the big brand, just without any logos.
The fit is not good for wide feet. They are only good for narrow and normal. If your feet is identical to the mold that they use for generic sizes, then it will fit you perfect and be very comfortable.
These are casual shoes and won't be great for dedicated sports like basketball or cross-country. 5-stars for being a great alternative to big name brands and for being very affordable. I can't think of anything bad to say about this shoe.
