reviews.title: My First Pair of Slip On Sneakers
reviews.text:
I own more pairs of shoes right now that at any time in my life. Part of the reason is because I am involved in more activities than I was in the past and I am thus in need of more types of shoes. My desire to diversify further led me to get my feet inside a pair of INZCOU Men's Non-Slip Gym Sneakers.

I’ve owned lots of pairs of sneakers, but this is the first time I have owned sneakers that do not have a tongue. Instead, these shoes are slip- on and that makes them a little easier to put on because you don’t have to reach down and pull the tongue out, like you commonly do with other shoes. Once they are slipped into place, you tie and are ready to go.

These shoes fit about as expected. The only small issue I had was with the arch support in one of the shoes- it seemed a little off and it hurt at first. But after walking around for a while, everything is fine now. And since these are the first pair of black sneakers I have ever owned, they match up nicely with my darker jeans. It’s a welcome change from the white sneakers I usually wear.

It’s good to have a variety of shoes and INZCOU sneakers have proven a good addition to my collection. I will still wear traditional sneakers, the type that doesn’t slip on. But I am happy to add this set of sneakers to my growing supply.

reviews.title: Very comfortable shoe if you don't have flat feet!
reviews.text:
The amount of comfort in this shoe is amazing. It competes easily with $130 overpronation shoes I own aside from no arch support. That's where it failed completely for me. Already tried replacing the insoles with arch support ones but the comfort level wasn't the same sadly. The provided insole is removable but is tacked down with adhesive. Didn't damage the shoes when removing it and with care I was able to put it back in.

So in conclusion, yes these are amazing shoes if you need some overpronation support or if your gait is neutral. In this case I'd highly recommend but sadly it didn't work for me. The shoes look amazing and they feel amazing. The price with the construction of the shoes is an amazing value if you just need some extra support and cushion. I'd consider this shoe to be plush in the midsole and the insole was comfortable but not a lot to make it heavy. If it weren't for my arch I would of ordered another shoe to keep in storage when this one wears out. Great service as usual from Amazon for the free return.

reviews.title: Great for walking and running, on even or paved surfaces.
reviews.text:
[[VIDEOID:c1b550fb45bc70f6146cd85777443b05]] The M MGRNDL sneakers are light, a bit flexible, and the air cushion design provides a cushioned impact. They have a good grip on surfaces, so they provide stability.

They do look good and the upper mesh fabric has some breathable properties.

They do a good job when walking and running short distances.
I would have liked if they mold to the foot better and had softer fabric, but at this price point it might be hard to find.

The M MGRNDL might not provide a good experience when running on uneven surfaces. They are not as comfortable as other well known and higher priced (twice as much) running sneakers brands.
The air cushion do provide a bit of support and comfort when running on even ground, such as concrete, pavement, grass or sand.
They do provide some level of impact resistant and support on the feet.

reviews.title: Surpassed My Expectations
reviews.text: I feel like now I can write an honest review. I have run for years, 3 5k per week. My go to shoes were NB or Brooks and I loved them. Started seeing Xero Shoes pop up on social media and YouTube. I looked them for months and it seemed like a gimmick product. After some time I said ok I am going to try this shoe and see if they meet their hype. In July of this year I ordered the Prio Cross Trainer model. Now their instructions said adjust over a couple of weeks. Well I said hell no and put them to the test right out of the box. I wore them every chance I got for 30 days straight. I found them comfortable right out of the box and I did not experience any foot or leg discomfort during the break period. I began liking them the more I wore them. At day 31 I put my Brooks Adrenaline runners on. Within 15 mins I was aware of how unbalanced I was in that shoe and while walking around in my home said, I can’t wear these any more I have to put my Xero Shoes on. I swear I referred to them specifically. I have since purchased 2 pairs of the HFS model runners and they are my favorite shoe. I wear them every day. In my old shoes at the end of the day I would change to my slides, I literally have these on until I go to bed. Closest thing to walking barefoot and still having a shoe on.

reviews.title: If you like barefoot shoes give these a try.
reviews.text: I wear a size 11 in most running shoes. Ordered a 10 1/2 in this and it fits great. My feet are on wider side so shorter sizes work for me if the shoe is somewhat wide. Really comfortable and appears well made. I look forward to trying other models. Unlike many other barefoot manufacturers I didn’t see any irregularities in how the shoe was put together.

reviews.title: Comfortable as "bare foot" shoes
reviews.text: I have purchased 2 Xero Men's HFS Running Shoes - Zero Drop and I have been very happy and comfortable wearing them. I've successfully walked and run with them when I visited Philippines for a month and have gotten used to the "bare foot" concept. Although I'm still comfortable wearing my Adidas running shoes, I found myself to be wearing my bare foot shoes more often now as I really find them much lighter, comfortable (for bare foot shoes) and lighter/easier to pack on day or extended trips. I've only been wearing them for the last 2 months or so, so long term I would still need to see how they stand up.

reviews.title: WAY too tight over the foot.  NOT for Diabetics, IMHO!
reviews.text:
I've had these on for about an hour now, so I am sure they are not returnable. That's too bad, because an hour has shown me that they are very uncomfortable. I cannot imagine who would find them wearable. Maybe someone with abnormally narrow feet.

The VERY stretchy material they are made from makes them hard to get on. You MUST use a shoehorn, and even then, it is not easy. They also - unpleasantly - squeeze the foot. After an hour, my toes are getting cold from low circulation! Seriously! Plus, the material does not breathe well, despite it's "perforated" appearance. So my feet are hot and wet.

The laces are just decoration. It's the tight material that holds them on. Plus, the artsy-craftsy arch inset in the instep is an invitation to soiling underneath it, without giving much arch support.
Could these be knock-offs? I assumed the attractive price was because they are a discontinued color. Maybe they are just fakes!.

PS THESE ARE NOT FOR DIABETICS. There is too much restriction of circulation.

I was advised to get "caged" Ultraboosts...the ones that lace normally. (The "cage" is the plastic framework for the laces.) But I liked the color of these.

Big mistake.

title: Brooks Men's Ghost 14 Neutral Running Shoe
description: Smooth roads are ahead when you put on the Ghost 14. This award-winning runner favorite now features 100% DNA LOFT in the midsole, for a softer, smoother ride. We’ve also improved the fit so the shoe adjusts even more comfortably to your foot.
features: THIS MEN'S SHOE IS FOR: Runners looking for a smooth ride that won’t distract from the fun of the run. The Ghost 14 offers a simplified midsole construction which creates more seamless transitions. This Brooks Ghost 14 is a certified PDAC A5500 Diabetic shoe and has been granted the APMA Seal of Acceptance. We recommend ordering Brooks running shoes 1/2 to one size larger than your dress shoe.

SUPPORT AND CUSHION: The Ghost 14 offers neutral support while providing high energizing cushioning. Ideal for road running, cross training, the gym or wherever you might want to take them! Predecessor: Ghost 13

BALANCED, SOFT CUSHIONING: BioMoGo DNA and DNA LOFT cushioning work together to provide a just-right softness underfoot without losing responsiveness and durability - yet it feels lighter than ever. DNA LOFT now makes up the entire midsole, for a softer, smoother, ride.
SMOOTH, STABLE RIDE: No matter how your foot lands, our Segmented Crash Pad - an integrated system of shock absorbers - will cushion every step and stride for smooth heel-to-toe transitions.
SOFT, SECURE, FIT: More strategic use of the 3D Fit Print upper technology provides structure that moves with the foot.

reviews.title: Brooks has lost a step on wear/quality, but still a very good shoe
reviews.text:
First, Brooks is a top running shoe manufacturer, and I always like buying their products, and they are to be applauded for releasing shoes in widths, which lets you get a shoe that fits, which is essential. If a shoe does not fit properly, then it will be extremely difficult to run (or walk any distance in). The Brooks Glycerin is one model up from the Ghost, that has better cushioning, but is no longer available in a Narrow width, and is more expensive, but the Ghost is a pretty good shoe on its own. I would have given the Ghost 5 stars, but the Ghost 14 is not quite perfect, having two areas where it could be better (and was better previously).

The first picture shows a Ghost 14 (on the left), next to a Ghost 13 (the previous model, on the right), and you can see the Ghost 14 has less tread, so wears out sooner, I would say roughly 50-75 miles of road (asphalt) running. The picture shows both shoes new. The Ghost 13 also was a little more cushioned, but you can offset that some by putting a different insole in the 14, and a lot of runners replace the insoles anyway. The thinner tread means less mileage on the 14s, but still probably as good as most of the competition, just no longer better here.

The second pictures shows the upper collar on a Ghost 14, and the fabric Brooks is using there (not so much on the 13 and earlier models) is nice and soft, but does not hold up. I generally see holes or failures at the top of the lace area, and on some shoes, towards the back collar area. You get a lot of fraying, sometimes holes, which is more an appearance problem than anything that would impact running in them, but means also you cannot wear them casually, at least where someone might see the failures. That may be an aspect that is supply chain related, they used to hold up better, but I have seen the problem on two pair of Ghost 14s, and other manufacturers do a bit better (probably needs a bit more nylon, to hold up longer).

I will say that the Ghost 14 has a narrower tongue at the top, that is shared with the 13 but was new there, and I have not seen it much in other shoes, but actually works very well, so I give kudos to Brooks on that design innovation. There is less chance that during a run the tongue will shift over into the forefoot, at least in a painful way, and you don't have to stop to shift it back.

So overall, particularly at this price point, the Brooks continues to be good value and one of the top shoes to consider, but as with anything, there are a couple of areas that could use further improvement.

reviews.title: Affordable and comfortable
reviews.text:
Update: I decided to keep these. Ok, so I am ashamed to wear them with jeans and a tee, I tried them for everyday but couldn't get over what I'll call the "dad sneakers" look. But I took these for a run and wow! They're very comfortable. A little clunky but flexible enough for daily training and the cushion is just right for me, sightly on the plush side but not squishy. These are my new daily runners. I don't know how long they'll last, but for the price, if I get 200 miles, I'll be happy.

Also, if you're a 3e/4e and you like or need a wide toe box, these will deliver. I'm a smaller 4e but i need a wide toe box, especially since I'm not willing to give up my injinji toe socks. These are very spacious with plenty of room for my toe splay.

-----

Original review: From the product pictures I wasn't sure if I'd like them or hate them. But for the price I figured I might as well try them. They fit nicely, have moderate cushion, and they're more flexible than I expected. They're basic sneakers, no bells or whistles. But they're comfortable enough I would try running in them. They're certainly not fashion forward, but I wouldn't be ashamed to wear them with jeans and a tee. And if you're looking for extra-wide these fit like a true 4e. I expected to hate them but I'm pleasantly surprised and I'll probably keep them and use they for everyday sneakers or runners.

In 1949, Mr. Kihachiro Onitsuka began his athletic footwear company (Onitsuka Co., Ltd.) by manufacturing basketball shoes out of his living room in Kobe, Japan. He chose the name ASICS for his company in 1977, based on a famous Latin phrase "Anima Sana In Corpore Sano," which, when translated, expresses the ancient ideal of "A Sound Mind in a Sound Body." Taking the acronym of this phrase, ASICS was founded on the belief that the best way to create a healthy and happy lifestyle is to promote total health and fitness. Today, ASICS offers a full line of performance-driven athletic shoes and technical active sports apparel and accessories dedicated to bringing harmony to the body and soul.

reviews.title: Crazy expensive for Made in Vietnam, but I like them.
reviews.text:
These shoes have a weight of 12oz each. Not super heavy, but not super lightweight either. Though you can see a thick white foam on the sole. . .The thickness of the bottom of the shoe is only about an 1/8 of an inch. If you’re running on a track or treadmill, that will probably not be an issue. But if you’re running on the road, I doubt the tread is going to last too long.

Padding on the inside is super-firm. Nice arch support. Nice firm padding around the heel / ankle.

Mesh breathable upper. The upper is all one piece, and the tongue is not separate. As you can from the pictures. . . .The laces are placed through plastic “shields” on each side of the shoe.

These shoes are Made in Vietnam. They are comfortable, and there is extra “bounce”, but I can’t say that they are worth the crazy expensive price. Nonetheless, I really like them.

reviews.title: So comfortable... like walking on air!
reviews.text:
The Adidas men’s Ultraboost 21’s are amaaaazing quality sneakers. My son wanted them, and I myself was not too sure about the pink on the bottom, however my teenager doesn’t mind the color at all. He actually loves the color combination.

The fit is perfect, true to size... and they are SO comfortable... almost like walking on air! You get that little bounce when you walk, and even more when running. They are well cushioned to keep your feet happy. They are a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for and these are worth it!

title: New Balance Men's FuelCore Coast V4 Running Shoe
description:

reviews.title: Made in China.  As written on the shoes. . . They are "mediocre" but decent overall.
reviews.text:
These are “mediocre” shoes. You know that because written on them is “Just So So”. Why a company would advertise that their shoes are “Just So So”. . . But. . . These shoes are Made in China and being sold by a Chinese company on Amazon. . . So. . . Perhaps it’s a phrase that’s “lost in translation”.

Though you can’t see it perfectly in the pictures. . . The soles of these shoes are see-through. The sole is hard plastic with a non-stop bottom. The uppers are mesh, so they are “airy”. The footbed has nice arch support, which is a bit unusual for Chinese shoes. Nice padding on the footbed, as well as around the ankle.

reviews.title: Waited a year of use before my review
reviews.text: To be honest I only bought these shoes from the way they looked (Camo) and only after watching a few viedeos on them.. the price is great.. the comfort is surprising and easy to wear. I weith right at 300 lbs and they support me just fine.. now know I also own Brooks, NB, Adidas, UA HOVR, etc... shoes as well.. are these as comfortable as they are.. No.. but they sure pack a punch bang for the buck thought.. NOW.. One huge issue.;. and again I wanted to wait and see if the soles "scuffed up: for traction.. but no.. If there is rain.. and the water on any surface is thin.. like tile, ocncrete, wood or anything besices most asphalt.. this shoe is like your walking on thin ice.. and YOU WILL SKID! Be warned.. Good.. but Dry use ONLY

Secondly, they feel on the smaller side. I always wear an 8 1/2 in Nike, but then seem a little snug. I loosened the laces and wore them around the house and I guess I will get use to them.
Definately not my favorite pair of shoes, but I hate the hassle of returning in stuff, so will keep them and see how it goes.

reviews.text: Love the shoe but OMG the sizing is WAY OFF! I have ordered this shoe four times consecutively and each time they run SUPER SMALL. My 10 year old daughter wears a 6.5 and I have had to order a 9 after ordering a 7, 7.5 and an 8.5 and none of those fit her. I will update my review once the 9’s come in. We order shoes every 4-6 months and she loves Nikes but these are made in Vietnam versus her last pair made in India and the sizing couldn’t be more off! See photos!

reviews.title: EXCELLENT SHOES RECOMMENDED BY PHYSICAL THERAPIST
reviews.text: I was recently diagnosed with Osteonecrosis and had to have a right total hip replacement due to collapsed hip socket.  My physical therapist recommended these for excellent support, mostly for my heel and ankle.  She was spot on.  Once the shoes were "broken in" they are wonderfully comfortable.  I did find them a bit tight across the top of my foot but gradually relaxed as I wore them.  I like that the tongues are also laced in.

reviews.title: Brooks is awesome yet again!
reviews.text: Love Brooks! My favorite running shows! They are consistently awesome no matter the model.

reviews.title: LOVE Brooks Tennies!!!
reviews.text: This is my third pair of Brooks and I’ll never buy anything else. They are SUPER comfy and SUPER durable. I have a history of Plantar Fasciitis (as many people who have worked 12-hr hosp shifts), and I’m EXTREMELY picky about my shoes. Brooks have EXCELLENT arch support. I require orthotics in most shoes that I wear, but not Brooks. I had my last pair for over 3 yrs of frequent wear. They are still structurally sound, but showing some cosmetic signs of wear. I bought this new pair for our 3-month trip in Europe. I have worn them for a week, and that is plenty to be assured that they are “broken in”. They are super comfy right out of the box!!

reviews.title: Great shoes for being in your feet. Lost a bit of cushion compared to previous versions.
reviews.text: I love Brooks and I’ve always worn Ravenna’s. I’m an ER nurse and I walk a lot, these are my go to work shoe. I wish there was a wee bit more arch support and I seem to feel they used to have more cushion overall, but an insert will make them perfect.

description:
The energetic design of the GEL-Excite™ 3 features a Rearfoot GEL® Cushioning System and breathable mesh upper for everyday comfort. This exciting update is a great choice for low mileage runners seeking a great fit and cushioned ride.
In 1949, Mr. Kihachiro Onitsuka began his athletic footwear company (Onitsuka Co., Ltd.) by manufacturing basketball shoes out of his living room in Kobe, Japan. He chose the name ASICS for his company in 1977, based on a famous Latin phrase "Anima Sana In Corpore Sano," which, when translated, expresses the ancient ideal of "A Sound Mind in a Sound Body." Taking the acronym of this phrase, ASICS was founded on the belief that the best way to create a healthy and happy lifestyle is to promote total health and fitness. Today, ASICS offers a full line of performance-driven athletic shoes and technical active sports apparel and accessories dedicated to bringing harmony to the body and soul.

reviews.title: Love the idea, needs some redesign
reviews.text: I really want to like this shoe more. I do actually use them a lot but it took nearly half a year to really break them in, and they’re still fairly difficult to slip into, as the opening is not very flexible. The shoe itself is tight enough where the laces don’t even really need to be there, and the toe box is fairly narrow which isn’t very good for running and hiking. My pinky toe often feels wedged by this one part of the design and frequently causes pain. I really REALLY like the idea of this shoe though and it’s still wearable for moderate hikes under 2 hours, I just wish they put more work and testing. It’s probably better for people with thinner, narrower feet. My feet are medium wide and the top part is kind of high.

features: Synthetic-and-mesh
Imported

THIS MEN'S SHOE IS FOR: Neutral runners looking for a lightweight shoe and a smooth ride without sacrificing cushioning. Whether you’re a Ghost loyalist or are lacing one up for the first time, you’ll find plenty to like.
SUPPORT AND CUSHION: The neutral support type provides high energizing cushioning. Ideal for road running, cross training, the gym or wherever you might want to take them! Predecessor: Ghost 11
BALANCED, SOFT CUSHIONING: BioMoGo DNA and DNA LOFT cushioning work together to provide a just-right softness underfoot without losing responsiveness and durability - yet it feels lighter than ever.
SMOOTH, STABLE RIDE: No matter how your foot lands, our Segmented Crash Pad - an integrated system of shock absorbers - will cushion every step and stride for smooth heel-to-toe transitions.
SOFT, SECURE, FIT: The newly engineered mesh and 3D Fit Print practically disappears on your foot with strategically placed stretch and structure.

reviews.title: I likes ‘em
reviews.text:
I’m not a runner so I can’t tell you what these or like for running in (though I’ve read good things about that), but I just wear them as every day, all around sneaks and they’re great for that. Great fit, cushy without making you feel like you’re going to fall over, and my previous pair of ghost 11s have held up nicely so I imagine these will too.

The instep on the shoes is just nylon mesh, so they’re anything but waterproof. They’re not even remotely water-resistant. But don’t expect that and I think you’ll probably be very happy with these shoes. Maybe not – different people’s feet are different and I’ve read a few reviews from people who aren’t thrilled with these. But for my part I’ve had a full range of shoes and sneakers over the years, some great and some not so much, and these are among the ones I’ve been happiest with. May you have a similar experience!

I work at a hospital, average 700+ miles a year at work, these have lasted 1.5 years but I wasn’t having to walk as much throughout Covid, things were a bit isolated in our hospital (largest university hospital in the Rocky Mountain region so we were busy but not spread out as usual).

Looking for my next pair since these are out of stock in my size.

Would love to see Brooks give health care workers a discount! But I’ll still pay since I know they are quality!

title: Mizuno Women's Wave Horizon 2 Running Shoe
description:
Introducing the softest, most stable ride ever to come out of Mizuno running. Our new stability technology called smooth ride support is combined with cloud Wave to create a soft, lively and cushioned feel with adequate support and smooth guidance.
Since our founding in 1906, we at Mizuno have taken special pride and pleasure in being able to participate in the exciting world of sports and in making the entire globe the stage for our activities. Each and every one of us is guided by the ideal of true sportsmanship. That was true nearly 100 years ago and is still true today. It is evident in our corporate philosophy which, simply stated, is "Contributing to society through the advancement of sporting goods and the promotion of sports." This philosophy is clearly reflected in our strong support of numerous worldwide sport events and in our dedication to advancing sports through cutting edge technology and research. Our product development strategy is to create products with features that enhance athlete performance and are unique to only Mizuno. These technological advancements make our sporting equipment and apparel go the extra mile and keep you in tip top playing form no matter the sport nor the conditions. Whether it's our Breath Thermo line of clothing which generates heat from the absorption of moisture to keep you warm in cooler temperatures, to our line of Arctic Touch garments that expels heat and moisture generated by the body during exercise to keep your body cool and comfortable, your comfort and performance are at the forefront of our innovation. From the diamond to the track, from the court to the fairway, Mizuno's commitment to Serious Performance shines through. Today, the high quality equipment that only Mizuno can produce are relied upon by athletes throughout the world. We produce superior quality equipment for serious performance, through the artful combination of technology and craftsmanship. Because, at Mizuno, your passion is our obsession.

reviews.title: Less structured support, lots of rubber to the road
reviews.text: Really like these; plenty of expected toe room (hallelujah!👏)  The footbed is more flat and neutral than my other Adidas, but they’re good. Less support, but still comfy. I love Adidas balance between support and bounce; some shoes i have sunk into so hard, they’re too much work to wear for someone with extra weight! Then there are the hard-as-cardboard styles that offer so much “support” they’re painful and unbearable. Not these! They conform yet manage to be stable; balance, zen-like ✌🏼 I am now officially an Adidas lady for the haul, they’re impressive. Oh, these are a bit wide on me, likely perfect on an “average” width foot. Oh, that glorious toe room! 💜 and one more thing; the platform is wider than any other shoes I have, and actually was hard to get used to. But I have.

reviews.title: COMFORT
reviews.text: I LOVE THIS SHOE DUE TO THE FACT I HAD HARDWARE INSTALLED INTO MY RIGHT FOOT BECAUSE MY TOES HAVE COLLAPSED FROM RHEUMATOID ARTHRITIS .... THE ORTHOPEADIC DOCTOR RECOMMEND THIS BRAND ( RUNNING SHOE) SINCE I WORK ON CONCRETE FLOORS ..... THIS SHOE HELPS A GREAT DEAL FOR ME AND I HOPE IT HELPS SOMEONE ELSE GOING THROUGH THE SAME THING .... ALL THESE DIFFERENT KINDS OF GYM SHOES I BOUGHT AND NOTHING WORKS TIL THE DOCTOR RECOMMEND THIS BRAND OF SHOE. I'M NOT GETTING PAID TO SAY THIS, BUT I WILL SAY, IF YOU WERE IN MY POSITION TRYING TO FIND COMFORT AFTER SPENDING $$$$ FOR SEVERAL DIFFERENT TYPES OF GYM SHOES AND SOMEONE RECOMMEND A CERTAIN BRAND COMPARED TO ALL THE $$$$ YOU SPENT PRIOR .... I WISH I COULD GET MY MONEY BACK ON EVERY F*****  SINGLE (18) PAIR OF SHOES I PURCHASED ... FROM NOW ON THIS IS MY ONLY GYM SHOE I'LL WEAR FOR NOW ON.... LOVE THE COMFORT, WIDTH, AND I'M ABLE TO WALK MORE THAN 1 MILE WITHOUT HAVING TO STOP BECAUSE MY FEET ARE HURTING DUE TO THE CHRONIC  (RA) CONDITION LIFE THROWN AT ME.  LOVE LOVE LOVE THESE SHOES

Perfect color - goes along the black I usually wear on a daily basis to school. I generally wear them all day before and after gym. Love love love them!

reviews.title: Comfortable, sturdy and a great value.
reviews.text:
First things First. I received this as a review item in exchange for an unbiased review. I have an 11 M foot (US) and while I wasn't overly crazy about the color, I realized they matched a lot of my race wear. So I decided to give them a try. The first run was a little tough but that's always the case (If you're new to running, trust me, don't run your first race without adequately breaking in your shoes). After about 15 miles I started to really like them.

So, you see the colors. I personally always buy the clip on laces which I did butI've probably got well over 60 miles on them now and while I'm pretty loyal to another brand (which is also costs substantially more) I will definitely be picking up another pair.

If you are a heel striker (work on your form before you suffer the consequences of it) these have ample cusioning in the back - but take a friendly word of advice, instead of getting into bad form. These are great shoes to improve your form with and once you have it, the extra padding in the back is not impediment. They are very light and fit well once worn in. I'm not trilled about the simultaneously yet cool look they have but so is life. You don't buy running shoes to look cool unless you're a poster you buy them for performance and these deliver.

Again I'm speaking to new runners and people that aren't that familiar with the sport. You don't want to have one pair you wear every day. They'll develop a wear pattern and it's not good. Instead buy at least two, ideally a few and alternate so that this happens at a much slower pace. From my experience, three pairs of shoes worn on alternating days will last much longer than one pair bought three times. And this is important b/c unless you're working on bearfoot running (which seems to still be a raging philosophical battle in the podiatric communities) you'll want support, comfort and stability. As a digression, I've tried barefoot running and it fundamentally changed the way I ran, until I stepped on a piece of glass and my right foot had yet to harden.

Again at the risk of lecturing remember that injuries are one of the biggest enemies to progress. You could easily run through broken glass on these and probably right over some smaller nails (I'm not advising it, just pointing it out). Styling aside I love these and will be picking up another pair or two in the near future.

description: Go further than ever before with the GEL-CONTEND 5 extra wide width men's running shoe from ASICS. Created to offer the stability required to help you go the distance this shoe offers a supportive fit thanks to an internal heel counter. Features include a removable sockliner Rearfoot GEL technology and an AMPLIFOAM midsole which ensure your foot remains cushioned every step of the way. The solid rubber outsole and stitch-down toe reinforcement also mean it has a high level of durability while the breathable athletic mesh means that your feet stay fresher for longer as you take on new challenges. Proudly sporting our classic logo on the side you can rest assured that the GEL-CONTEND 5 shoe will give you comfort and protection when you need it most. Weight: 10.25. Heel Height: 22mm. reviews.title: These run a size too small (Mens)
reviews.text: Received my new running shoes about 15 minutes ago from Amazon.  I was excited to use these shoes on a run and tried them on.  I have a narrow foot and wear an 11 in New Balance (based on 3 pairs of shoes), and every other brand except Salomon and Saucony that run small.  Well, these run small, really small.  My toe was touching the end of the shoe, and these were very tight and hard to get on (I have a narrow foot!).  These are lightweight, look good, and appear to be somewhat well made.  The soles look like they are cheaper foam, and don't really have a running shoe tread.  Not sure how long they would last, but at the under forty dollar price when marked down, not a bad deal.  I would expect to get at least 200 miles on pavement running out of these.

title: ASICS Women's GT-2000 4 Running Shoes
description:
The gt-2000 4 is the core runner’s bread and butter with its balance of cushioning and stability, outfitted by the comfortably supportive dynamic duomax and guidance trusstic system that also enhance gait efficiency. Our rear foot and forefoot gel cushioning systems are now even more adaptive, assisting mild to moderate over pronators alike with greater support, while the fluid ride midsole offers the ultimate ride.
In 1949, Mr. Kihachiro Onitsuka began his athletic footwear company (Onitsuka Co., Ltd.) by manufacturing basketball shoes out of his living room in Kobe, Japan. He chose the name ASICS for his company in 1977, based on a famous Latin phrase "Anima Sana In Corpore Sano," which, when translated, expresses the ancient ideal of "A Sound Mind in a Sound Body." Taking the acronym of this phrase, ASICS was founded on the belief that the best way to create a healthy and happy lifestyle is to promote total health and fitness. Today, ASICS offers a full line of performance-driven athletic shoes and technical active sports apparel and accessories dedicated to bringing harmony to the body and soul.
features: 100% Synthetic
Imported
Rubber sole
Impact Guidance System (I.G.S): ASICS design philosophy that employs linked componentry to enhance the foot's natural gait from heel strike to toe-off.
Dynamic duomax Support System: This evolution of duomax system enhances stability and support, with reduced weight and increased platform support.
Rear foot and Forefoot GEL Cushioning Systems: Attenuates shock during impact and toe-off phases, and allows movement in multiple planes as the foot transitions through the gait cycle.
Fluid ride: fluid ride provides the ultimate combination of bounce back and cushioning properties with reduced weight and exceptional durability.
Guidance Truss tic System: This Truss tic System integrates Guidance Line construction for enhanced gait efficiency while providing midfoot structural integrity.

reviews.title: Great shoe for an over-pronator like me
reviews.text: I've used the GT-2000 shoes over the last few years and have yet to have issue with them. I over-pronate pretty badly and this shoe offers great support for that issue; My knees thank me. I found the shoe to fit exactly true to size and for those reviews that say it's small, people tend to forget that your feet swell when you run, especially longer distances! My personal size foot is between a 6.5-7 and I typically wear a 7 shoe for running, dress, or sandals. I can't say I know the difference between the GT-2000 model numbers (1-5?) except for new-ness. I have no issue with wearing older models and like the cheaper prices. For reference, I run half marathons several times a year on city sidewalks, asphalt, dirt roads, and dirt trails.
